item.description:

item.title: Where do we stand with Omicron?
item.description:
There has been a flood of new data in the past few weeks regarding Omicron’s impact throughout the world, and specifically on the influence of vaccination (with or without boosters) on symptomatic infections, hospitalizations, and deaths, including durability. It’s actually remarkable how much and how quickly we are learning about Omicron and our abilit…

item.title: Occoquan, Virginia's Embrace of Old and New
item.description:
I recently visited Occoquan, a historic riverside town at the northern edge of Virginia’s Prince William County about 40 minutes south of Washington, D.C. Like so many quaint little towns, Occoquan is small, exclusive, a little boutiquey, and has traded whatever commercial purpose it once had for more or less being a D.C. and Northern Virginia bedroom c…

URL: https://thedeletedscenes.substack.com/p/occoquan-virginias-embrace-of-old?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Why, This Is COVID. Nor Are We Over It.

item.title: Exploiting Racism to Save Himself (audio)
item.description:
Listen now (9 min) | Dear Friends, As I state below and in this audio post, "Trump’s threats made clear his intention to trigger his mob when the rule of law finally finds him. This cannot be treated blithely, with low-key patience or with the courtesy typically afforded a former president.” As much as we may like to move on or look away, the danger this represents must be confronted. That includes recognizing his demagogic impulse to exploit racism to save himself…

URL: https://america.substack.com/p/exploiting-racism-to-save-himself-e5d?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

item.title: Inflation is forgetting
item.description:
The other day, I was writing about inflation and the national debt, and a commenter asked me whether inflation had caused the debt to go down in real terms. I checked, and to my surprise, I found it had! From the first quarter of 2021 to the third quarter, despite two huge Covid relief bills — the $0.9 trillion bill in December 2020 and Biden’s $1.9 trillion bill in March — the national debt actually fell in inflation-adjusted terms…

URL: https://noahpinion.substack.com/p/inflation-is-forgetting?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Why, This Is COVID. Nor Are We Over It.

item.title: Kamil Galeev
item.description:
Kamil Galeev on Twitter

“The largest and the most popular party in Russia in 1917 wasn’t Communists. It was a Socialist Revolutionary Party. They were non-Marxist agrarian socialists who built their agenda around land distribution. Ofc they were the most popular in a country of destitute peasants”

URL: https://twitter.com/kamilkazani/status/1490729328585310210

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022 - Russian history supplement

item.title: Kamil Galeev
item.description:
Kamil Galeev on Twitter

“Who was *the* head of that committee that overthrew the Provisional Government and led communists to power, you may ask? It was Lazimir. How come you never heard of him? Well, he wasn’t a Bolshevik. He wasn’t Communist at all”

URL: https://twitter.com/kamilkazani/status/1490728791257202694

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022 - Russian history supplement

item.title: Kamil Galeev
item.description:
Kamil Galeev on Twitter

“I would even speculate, though I can’t prove it, that this Stalinist practice might continue till this very day in modern Russia. Being compromised = committing tons of things that are criminal from the perspective of the dominant narrative = prerequisite to promotion”

URL: https://twitter.com/kamilkazani/status/1490753939830050818

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022 - Russian history supplement

item.title: Kamil Galeev
item.description:
Kamil Galeev on Twitter

“On the bright side, Yeltsin’s family made a right choice. Putin indeed was personally loyal and never betrayed his benefactor. His very first order as an acting president was to guarantee safety of an ex-president and his family and give them very wide material privileges”

URL: https://twitter.com/kamilkazani/status/1490166730781433856

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022 - Russian history supplement

item.title: Kamil Galeev
item.description:
Kamil Galeev on Twitter

“Immediately upon his succession, Putin starts dismantling entire structure of federalism. He saw autonomous elites and regional agency as a problem and sought unlimited power. In fact, Yeltsin could have exercised huge power, too. He was just more hesitant to use it. Putin wasn’t”

URL: https://twitter.com/kamilkazani/status/1490167618501681153

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022 - Russian history supplement

item.title: Kamil Galeev
item.description:
Kamil Galeev on Twitter

“RUSAL - second largest producer of aluminium in the world is headquartered in Moscow. Its main production is concentrated in Siberia. Siberians who actually work there and have to suffer from pollutions RUSAL production creates get almost nothing. Cuz taxes r paid in Moscow”

URL: https://twitter.com/kamilkazani/status/1490173798154268677

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022 - Russian history supplement

item.title: Kamil Galeev
item.description:
Kamil Galeev on Twitter

“Another pattern is appointing Putin’s personal bodyguards as governors. Indeed governors of Tula, Yaroslavl, Astrakhan and Kaliningrad are Putin’s former bodyguards with no political or civil service experience”

URL: https://twitter.com/kamilkazani/status/1490177607563821065

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022 - Russian history supplement

item.title: Kamil Galeev
item.description:
Kamil Galeev on Twitter

“This policy has several consequences. First of all, as a result most of people who directly govern Russian regions are nomadic bandits. Not stationary ones. They are appointed there for a while and know they will be appointed somewhere else soon. They are not gonna root in”

URL: https://twitter.com/kamilkazani/status/1490179942587330563

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022 - Russian history supplement

item.title: Alexey Guzey
item.description:
Alexey Guzey on Twitter

“I used to sleep the normal 7.5 hours a day. Over the last 180 days I have slept an average of 5 hours 57 minutes per day. So, after 2 years of experimentation and occasional deep dives into the scientific literature, here are my theses on sleep: https://t.co/7BayHADQaN”

URL: https://twitter.com/alexeyguzey/status/1491816558661885953

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022

item.title: Theses on Sleep - Alexey Guzey
item.description:
URL: https://guzey.com/theses-on-sleep/

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022

item.title: QC
item.description:
QC on Twitter

“@alexeyguzey re: sleepiness indicating the boringness of the environment, ime it goes deeper than that. sleepiness can become a psychological defense against many uncomfortable emotions and “boredom” is often hiding one or more of these”

URL: https://twitter.com/QiaochuYuan/status/1492014995965505538

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022

item.title: Royal Statistical Society
item.description:
Royal Statistical Society on Twitter

“We asked a sample of MPs the same simple probability question we asked them ten years ago - if you toss a coin twice, what is the probability of getting two heads?”

URL: https://twitter.com/RoyalStatSoc/status/1492061997885763584

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022

item.title: Royal Statistical Society
item.description:
Royal Statistical Society on Twitter

“This time round, around half of respondents (52%) gave the correct answer of 🥁 25% This is a likely improvement from when we polled MPs in 2011, when 40% of respondents gave the correct answer”

URL: https://twitter.com/RoyalStatSoc/status/1492062361812930564

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022

item.title: Charles Brenner, PhD
item.description:
Charles Brenner, PhD on Twitter

“in 1997 David was a postdoc with Lenny Guarente & published a very nice paper showing that SIR2 extends the number of times a yeast mother cell can produce daughter cells by controlling formation of ribosomal DNA circles https://t.co/XRwB3LLr9q https://t.co/RDgrJEDzUZ”

URL: https://twitter.com/CharlesMBrenner/status/1492902239312039938

item.title: Ben (hiring 65/∞ teammates)
item.description:
Ben (hiring 65/∞ teammates) on Twitter

“In my experience, they *are* near-universally effective—for example, my top piece of perf feedback from reports is that our 1:1s are very useful—but this updates me that that’s not the default and perhaps even my “care a lot” advice in https://t.co/8nDvLS3HkA is insufficient.”

URL: https://twitter.com/benskuhn/status/1491059717619458056

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022

item.title: Benjamin Todd
item.description:
Benjamin Todd on Twitter

“There’s $1bn+ available for these anti-pandemic megaprojects: 1. Int early detection centre 2. Actually good PPE 3. Rapid & broad antivirals & vaccines 4. Bioweapons watchdog 5. Self-sterilizing buildings 6. Refuges If you might help, fill out the form: https://t.co/ILeXx8MLHJ”

URL: https://twitter.com/ben_j_todd/status/1491389705459736580

source: Best of Twitter - Week of February 7, 2022
